topics.overview: A computer network is a digital telecommunications network which allows nodes to share resources.
topics.name: Networking

topics.overview: In computing, `traceroute` and `tracert` are computer network diagnostic commands for displaying the route (path) and measuring transit delays of packets across an Internet Protocol (IP) network.
topics.name: Traceroute

topics.overview: In computing, traceroute and tracert are computer network diagnostic commands for displaying the route and measuring transit delays of packets across an Internet Protocol network.
topics.name: Tracert

topics.overview: Git is a distributed version-control system for tracking changes in source code during software development.
topics.name: Git

topics.overview: Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform, offering over 165 fully featured services from data centers globally. Millions of customers —including the fastest-growing startups, largest enterprises, and leading government agencies—trust AWS to power their infrastructure, become more agile, and lower costs.
topics.name: Amazon Web Services (AWS)

topics.overview: netcat (often abbreviated to nc) is a computer networking utility for reading from and writing to network connections using TCP or UDP.
topics.name: netcat

topics.overview: In computing, netstat (network statistics) is a command-line network utility that displays network connections for Transmission Control Protocol (both incoming and outgoing), routing tables and network protocol statistics, and uses a number of network interfaces (network interface controller or software-defined network interface).
topics.name: Netstat

topics.overview: Jenkins is a self-contained, open source automation server that can be used to automate all sorts of tasks related to building, testing, and delivering or deploying software.
topics.name: Jenkins

topics.overview: PowerShell is a task-based command-line shell and scripting language built on .NET.

topics.name: Iptables

topics.overview: Markdown is a way to write content for the web. It's written in what people call 'plaintext'; this is just the regular alphabet, with a few symbols (such as `*` and `#`).
topics.name: Markdown

topics.overview: The Linux open-source operating system, or Linux OS, is a freely distributable, cross-platform operating system, based on Unix. It can be installed on PCs, laptops, netbooks, mobile and tablet devices, video game consoles, servers, supercomputers and more.
topics.name: Linux

Variables are of course very commonly used, across all programming languages.
modules.name: Variables

modules.overview: A closure in Groovy is an open, anonymous, block of code that can take arguments, return a value and be assigned to a variable.  A closure may reference variables declared in its surrounding scope.  In opposition to the formal definition of a closure, a closure in the Groovy language can also contain free variables that are defined outside of its surrounding scope.
modules.name: Closures

modules.overview: This document aims to cover the basics of the Groovy programming language's syntax.
modules.name: Syntax

modules.overview: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) is a web service that provides secure, resizable compute capacity in the cloud. It is designed to make web-scale cloud computing easier for developers.
modules.name: Elastic Cloud Compute (EC2)

modules.overview: Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) lets you provision a logically isolated section of the AWS Cloud where you can launch AWS resources in a virtual network that you define.
modules.name: Virtual Private Cloud (VPC)

questions.value: What can port scanning be used for?
questions.answer: Finding out what ports are available on a host.
choices: Monitoring TCP traffic going through the given ports.

modules.overview: Port scanning is a technique used for finding out which ports have an application running on them, making them accessible.
modules.name: Port Scanning with netcat

questions.value: What is the Netstat command used for?
questions.answer: Displaying network connections for Transmission Control Protocol, routing tables, and a number of network interface and network protocol statistics
choices: Provide information about the currently running processes, including their process identification numbers (PIDs)
Allowing you to run programs with the security privileges of another user

modules.overview: In computing, netstat (network statistics) is a command-line network utility that displays network connections for Transmission Control Protocol (both incoming and outgoing), routing tables and network protocol statistics, and uses a number of network interfaces (network interface controller or software-defined network interface).
modules.name: Introduction

modules.overview: The netstat tool is very important for Linux network administrators, as well as system administrators, to monitor and troubleshoot their network related problems and determine network traffic performance.
modules.name: Basic Usage for Linux

modules.overview: Netstat on Windows displays active TCP connections, ports on which the computer is listening, Ethernet statistics, the IP routing table, IPv4 statistics (for the IP, ICMP, TCP, and UDP protocols), and IPv6 statistics (for the IPv6, ICMPv6, TCP over IPv6, and UDP over IPv6 protocols).
modules.name: Basic Usage for Windows
